headline: Poorly run company
pros: Learned a lot quickly. Made some good friends.
cons: Literally everything else. Management is horrible and unhelpful.

headline: don't recommend
cons: No one is happy. Management is clueless.

headline: Cf
pros: Very good at work place and nice
cons: No fun at work and need to improve

headline: Don't Do It!
pros: Nice co-workers, that is literally the only pro.
cons: There are really to many to name.

headline: Don’t do it
cons:
Everything
Poor management from the top
Impulse decisions made no sense
Constantly worked alone
High turnover (rare to find someone who lasts more than 6 months)


We were working with low staff and management didn’t care to ask us how we were actually doing...... just complained about long lines even though you were working alone.
No perks at all for part time
No opportunity to grow in company
Treat employees like crap
Immediately blame employees without consulting them on their side of the story

headline: Stressful, no work/life balance, difficult core system,
pros: The benefits Offered i.e Health & dental insurance were competitive. Most of the co workers in the back office were friendly and knowledgeable.
cons: Many cons. Employees are made to feel appreciated. The pay is a joke for what’s expected from employees in both retail branch and back office. Not enough detailed training on the Extremely dated & difficult core system. Staff Turnover is ridiculous so there’s never enough coverage to handle the teller line and desk. There are many different accounts/products that are confusing for members and staff.

headline: Would highly recommend
pros:
Great environment
Open Communication with upper management
Oppurtunities to grow if self motivated and hard working
Great benefits
cons: Old management style in a lot of departments

headline: Assistant branch manager
pros: Nothing very poor upper management skills
cons: Everything stay away from this place. Run fast

headline: Great benefits, knowledgeable back office staff and management
pros: Upper management is always available to answer any questions. They know each employee by name. The instant message system is a great way to communicate efficiently with an entire department at once especially if you have a member in front of you.
cons: Compensation for the work load required is on the low side. There seems to be a lot of Staff turnover.

headline: Good place if you are positive
pros:
Small company so executive management is readily available.
HR Department strict but open to listening, and very proactive.
The people who work there are wonderful.
cons:
There can be cliques/clashes between corporate and branches.
It's a not-for-profit so don't expect to get paid well.
Sometimes morale gets low.
